column5: Take it for what it's worth....  http://www.buffalonews.com/incoming/article581857.ece

I`m old, I remember Lake Erie in Ohio in the 50`s -60`s -70`s, it had a tendency to look like green pea soup once it warmed. I had to go to Ontario to catch my first Walleye they were scarce around here. The lack of Walleye here was what started my dad and his friends going to Ontario in the 1950`s.
Here is a satellite image of the lake yesterday........Lots of dirty water mixed in which makes it hard to decipher. But you can make out the green in some areas that represents the Algae bloom
